div.l: And bare it softe vnto his beddys fete
Sone after the wyf her rowtynge lete
And gan a wake and wente her out to pysse
And cam ayen and gan her cradyll mysse
And gropyd here and there but she fonde non
Alas quod she I hadde almost mysgon
I hadde almost goon to the clerkys bed
Ey benedicite than hadde I fowle sped
And forth she goth tyll she the cradyll fonde
She gropyth alwaye ferther wyth her honde
And fond the bed and thought not but good
By cause that the cradyll by it stood
And nyst where she was for it was derke
But fayr and well she crepte vnto the clerke
And lyth full styll ⁊and wold haue caught a slepe
Wythin a whyle this Iohn vp lepe
And on this good wyf he layeth on sore
So mery a fytte ne hadde not she ful yore
He prickyd harde and sore as he were mad
This Ioly lyf haue thyse two clerkes lad
Tyll that the thyrde cok began to synge
¶ Aleyn wext wery in the dawnynge
For he had swonken all the longe nyght
And sayd fare well malyn swete wyght
The daye is come I may no lenger byde
Yet euermore where so I go or ryde
I am thyn owne clerke so haue I hele
¶ Now dere lemman quod she go fare well
But or thou go o thynge I woll the telle
Whan that þᵘou wendest homwarde by the melle
Ryght at entre of the dore behynde
Thou shalt a cake of half a busshell fynde
That was made of thyn owne mele
Whyche that I halpe my syre for to stele
And good lemman god the saue and kepe
And wyth that worde almost she gan to wepe
¶ Aleyn vp ryst and thought or that it dawe
I woll go crepe in by my felowe
And fonde the cradyll wyth his honde anon
By god thoughte he all wronge haue I gon
My hed is toty of my swynk to nyght
That maketh me that I go not a ryght
I wote well by the cradyll I haue mys go
Here lyeth the myllar and his wyf also
And forth he goth a twenty deuyll waye
In to the bed there the myllare laye
He wende haue cropen in by his felowe Iohn
And by the myllar in he crept anon
And caught hym by the necke and softe spake
He sayd thou Iohn thou swyneshede awake
For cristys soule and here a noble game
For by that lorde that callyd is saynt Iame
As I haue thries in this short nyght
Swyuyd the myllars doughter bolt vpryght
Whyles thou hast as a cowarde be agast
¶ Ye false harlot quod the myllar hast
A fals traytour fals clerke quod he
Thou shalt be ded by goddys dygnyte
Who durst be so bolde to dysperage
My doughter that is of suche lygnage
And by the throte bolle he caughte aleyn
And he hente hym dispytously agayn
And on the nose he smot hym wyth his fyst
Downe ran the blody streme vpon his brest
And in the floor wᵗith the nose ⁊and mouth to kroke
They walowed as pygges don in a poke
And vp they goon and downe ayen anon
Tyll that the myllar sporued at a stoon
And downe he fell bakward on his wyf
That wyst no thyng of this nyce stryf
For she was falle a slepe a lytyll wyght
Wyth Iohn the clerke þᵗat wakyd had all nyght
And wyth the fall out of her slepe she brayd
Help holy crosse of bromehom she sayd
In manus tuas to the lord I calle
Awake symond the fende is on me falle
Myn herte is broken helpe I am but ded
There lyeth one on my wombe and on my hed
Help symkyn for the fals clerkes fyghte
This Iohn stert vp as faste as he myghte
And graspyd by the walles to and fro
To fynde a staf and she stert vp also
And knewe the efters bet than dyde this Iohn
And by the wall a staf she toke anon
And sawe a lytyll shymerynge of a lyghte
For at an hole in shone the mone brighte
And by that lyght she sawe hem bothe two
But sykerly she nyst who was who
And as she sawe a whyte thynge in her eye
And whan she gan this whyte thynge aspye
